enumList.name: AddressKindEnum
enumList.description: Kind of Address.

value.name: mailing
value.description: The mailing address of a business associate or facility.

value.name: physical
value.description: The physical address - location - of a business associate or facility.

value.name: both
value.description: Both the mailing address and the physical address.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: AddressQualifier
enumList.description: What kind of email (or phone) is this? Is it a work phone? Or personal? Or is a permanent one?

value.name: personal
value.description: The phone number or email address is personal, and can probably be received at the business associates home.

value.name: work
value.description: The phone number or email is a work number, which is subject to change if the business associate changes jobs.

value.name: permanent
value.description: The phone number or email is permanent, which will still be valid if the person changes home or work locations.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: BalanceDestinationType
enumList.description: Defines a type of destination.

value.name: harbor
value.description: Defines the name of the destination harbor

value.name: terminal
value.description: Defines the name of the destination terminal

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: BalanceEventKind
enumList.description: Defines a type of event related to a product balance by reference to its date.

value.name: bill of lading
value.description: For a cargo, the date of the bill of lading for the cargo involved.

value.name: transaction date
value.description: For a transaction (e.g. gas sales transaction), the date for the transaction involved.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: BalanceFlowPart
enumList.description: Defines a subdivision of a flow related to the stock balance.

value.name: opening balance
value.description: A volume that is the total volume on stock at the beginning of a time period.

value.name: closing balance
value.description: A volume that is the total volume on stock at the end of a time period.

value.name: input to storage
value.description: A volume that is the total volume of additions to a stock within a given time period.

value.name: lifting entitlement
value.description: A volume that is the contracted volume which can be transferred

value.name: lifting entitlement remaining
value.description: A volume that is the contracted volume which is not transferred but which remains available for subsequent transfer

value.name: gain/loss
value.description: A volume that is a lack of proper proportion or relation between the corresponding input and liftings transactions.

value.name: adjusted closing
value.description: A volume that remains after the operation of transfer

value.name: lifted
value.description: A volume that is transferred ("lifted")

value.name: production -- value adjustment
value.description: A value that is adjusted due to a change in the value of a product.

value.name: transaction
value.description: Typically used within the cargo shipper operations and in this context is a change in ownership as executed between shippers of the cargo.

value.name: completed lifting
value.description: A volume that is the total volume of a hydrocarbon product that is exported from a stock within a given time period.

value.name: production imbalance
value.description: A gas volume that is the difference between gas volume entering and exiting a shipper's nomination portfolio. This will take into account all differences whatever the time or reason it occurs.

value.name: partial lifting
value.description: A volume that is the volume of a hydrocarbon product lifting up to a (not completed) determined point in time.

value.name: closing storage inventory
value.description: A closing storage balance that is adjusted according to imbalance at end of period.

value.name: tanker lifting
value.description: A volume that is the volume of a hydrocarbon product lifting transferred by tanker

value.name: pipeline lifting
value.description: A volume that is the volume of a hydrocarbon product lifting transferred by pipeline

value.name: opflex
value.description: A gas volume that is the unused and available quantity of gas within a gas transportation system and/or at one or many gas producing fields that is accessible by the operator responsible for gas transportation for the purposes of alleviating field curtailment.

value.name: linepack
value.description: A gas volume that is the quantity of gas which the operator responsible for gas transportation decides must be provided by the gas producing fields in order to make deliveries as requested by gas shippers and provide operating tolerances.

value.name: transfer
value.description: A volume that is the volume of a hydrocarbon product which changes custody in the operation

value.name: production - mass adjustment
value.description: A part of a mass adjustment process of a given production volume.

value.name: swap
value.description: A swap of a volume in between different parties (often used in crude sales), e.g. "I have this volume with this quality and value and you can give me this higher volume for it with a lower quality."

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: BusinessUnitKind
enumList.description: Defines a type of business unit.

value.name: company
value.description: A business unit which is a whole company

value.name: field
value.description: A business unit which is a single field

value.name: license
value.description: A business unit which is a single license

value.name: business area
value.description: A business unit which is a group of fields or licenses

value.name: platform
value.description: A business unit which is a single platform

value.name: terminal
value.description: A business unit which is a terminal

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: CalculationMethod
enumList.description: Defines the calculation methods available for "filling in" values in an indexed set.

value.name: none
value.description: No calculations are performed to create data where none exists at index points within an existing set of data.

value.name: step wise constant
value.description: The value is held constant until the next index point.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ContactPreference
enumList.description: The preferred method of contacting a business associate.

value.name: business mail
value.description: Postal mail at the business address.

value.name: business fax
value.description: Business fax.

value.name: business email
value.description: Business email.

value.name: business mail
value.description: Postal mail at the business address.

value.name: business phone
value.description: Business voice phone.

value.name: mobile
value.description: Mobile phone.

value.name: pager
value.description: Pager.

value.name: personal fax
value.description: Personal fax.

value.name: personal email
value.description: Personal email.

value.name: personal mail
value.description: Postal mail at the personal address.

value.name: personal phone
value.description: Personal voice phone.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: CrewType
enumList.description: The type of personnel grouping.

value.name: catering crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from the catering contractor spending the night at the installation.

value.name: contractor crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from other than operator spending the night at the installation.

value.name: day visitors
value.description: A count that is the number of persons visiting the installation but not spending the night at the installation.

value.name: drilling contract crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from the drilling contractor spending the night at the installation.

value.name: own crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from the operator normally working on the installation and spending the night there.

value.name: own other crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from the operator normally not working on the installation, but spending the night there.

value.name: other crew
value.description: A count that is the number of persons from an unknown source normally not working on the installation, but spending the night there.

value.name: personnel on board
value.description: A count of the total personnel on board.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: DataQuality
enumList.description: Defines the quality of data

value.name: best
value.description: Data quality is of the best standard possible

value.name: good
value.description: Data quality is of good standard

value.name: fair
value.description: Data quality is of fair standard

value.name: poor
value.description: Data quality is of poor standard

value.name: invalid
value.description: Data quality is sufficiently bad as to render the data invalid

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: EndpointQualifier
enumList.description: The meaning of the endpoint for min/max query parameters on "growing objects".

value.name: inclusive
value.description: The endpoint of the range is inclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be within the range.

value.name: exclusive
value.description: The endpoint of the range is exclusive of the specified range value. That is, a node index value which matches the specified range value is considered to be outside the range.

value.name: extensive
value.description: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if an exact value match is not found. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. Basically, this concept is designed to support interpolation across an undefined point.

value.name: overlap extensive
value.description: The endpoint of the range may be extended to the first encountered value if the interval is overlapped with the index interval. That is, if a node index value does not match the specified range value then the next smaller value (on minimum end) or larger value (on maximum end) in the index series should be used as the endpoint. This concept is designed to select ALL nodes whose index interval overlap with the query range.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: EndpointQualifierInterval
enumList.description: The meaning of the endpoint for some interval.

value.name: inclusive
value.description: The endpoint of the interval is inclusive of the specified value.

value.name: exclusive
value.description: The endpoint of the interval is exclusive of the specified value.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: EosModelKind
enumList.description: Kind of equation of state model.

value.name: bwrs
value.description: A modification of the Benedict-Webb-Rubin equation of state by Professor Kenneth E. Starling of the University of Oklahoma.

value.name: cubeos
value.description: A cubic equation of state

value.name: pr
value.description: Peng-Robinson equation of state.

value.name: prvt
value.description: Peng-Robinson with volume translation.

value.name: srk
value.description: Soave modification of Redlich-Kwong equation of state.

value.name: srkvt
value.description: Soave-Redlich-Kwong with volume translation.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: FacilityParameter
enumList.description: Defines kinds of facility parameters.

value.name: absorbed dose class
value.description: The amount of energy absorbed per mass.

value.name: activity (of radioactivity) class
value.description: A measure of the radiation being emitted.

value.name: alarm absolute pressure
value.description: Absolute minimum pressure of the flow stream before the system will give an alarm. Equivalent to element absoluteMinPres in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: amount of substance class
value.description: Molar amount of a substance.

value.name: angle per time
value.description: The angular velocity. The rate of change of an angle.

value.name: annulus inner diameter
value.description: Inner diameter of Annulus.

value.name: annulus outer diameter
value.description: Outer diameter of annulus.

value.name: area per area
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is area.

value.name: atmospheric pressure
value.description: The average atmospheric pressure during the reporting period. Equivalent to element atmosphere in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: attenuation class
value.description: A logarithmic, fractional change of some measure, generally power or amplitude, over a standard range. This is generally used for frequency attenuation over an octave.

value.name: available
value.description: Indicates the availability of the facility. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "true" indicates that it is available for use. That is, it may be currently shut-down but it can be restarted. A value of "false" indicates that the facility is not available to be used. That is, it cannot be restarted at this time.

value.name: available room
value.description: Defines the unoccupied volume of a tank. Zero indicates that the tank is full.

value.name: block valve status
value.description: Indicates the status of a block valve. This should be implemented as a string value. A value of "open" indicates that it is open. A value of "closed" indicates that it is closed.

value.name: categorical
value.description: The abstract supertype of all enumerated string properties.

value.name: cathodic protection output current
value.description: Rectifier DC Output.

value.name: cathodic protection output voltage
value.description: Rectifier DC Output.

value.name: choke position
value.description: A coded value describing the position of the choke (open, close, travelling).

value.name: choke setting
value.description: A fraction value (percentage) of the choke opening.

value.name: code
value.description: A property whose values are constrained to specific string values

value.name: concentration of B class
value.description: molar concentration of a substance.

value.name: continuous
value.description: The abstract supertype of all floating point properties.

value.name: data transmission speed class
value.description: used primarily for computer transmission rates.

value.name: delta temperature class
value.description: Delta temperature refers to temperature differences. For non-zero offset temperature scales, Fahrenheit and Celsius, the conversion formulas are different than for absolute temperatures.

value.name: density
value.description: The density of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element densityValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: density flow rate
value.description: The mass basis flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. This is used for things like a sand component. Equivalent to element densityFlowRate in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: density standard
value.description: The density of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element densityValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: dewpoint temperature
value.description: The temperature at which the specified component product within the flow will start to condense out of the gaseous phase. Equivalent to element hcDewpoint or waterDewpoint (depending on the specified product) in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: differential pressure
value.description: The differential pressure between the ports. Presumes a facility with only two ports. Equivalent to element portDiff/presDiff in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: differential temperature
value.description: The differential pressure between the ports. Presumes a facility with only two ports. Equivalent to element portDiff/tempDiff in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: dimensionless class
value.description: A dimensionless quantity is the ratio of two dimensional quantities. The quantity types are not apparent from the basic dimensionless class, but may be apparent in variations - such as area per area, volume per volume, or mass per mass.

value.name: discrete
value.description: The abstract super-type of all integer properties.

value.name: electrochemical equivalent class
value.description: An electrochemical equivalent differs from molarity in that the valence (oxidation reduction potential) of the element is also considered.

value.name: energy length per time area temperature
value.quantityMeasureClass: energy length per time area temperature

value.name: facility uptime
value.description: The amount to time the facility was available during the specified period.

value.name: flow rate
value.description: The flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element flowRateValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: flow rate standard
value.description: The flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element flowRateValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: force per force
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is force.

value.name: frequency interval class
value.description: An octave is a doubling of a frquency.

value.name: gamma ray API unit class
value.description: This class is defined by the API, and is used for units of gamma ray log response.

value.name: gas liquid ratio
value.description: The ratio of ratio of gas to liquid for all products in the whole flow stream. Equivalent to element gasLiquidRatio in the productVolume data-schema. The volumes related to each component should have been at or converted to the same pressure and temperature.

value.name: gas oil ratio
value.description: Gas oil ratio. The ratio between the total gas volume and the total oil volume in the flow stream. Equivalent to element gor in the productVolume data-schema. The volumes related to each component should have been at or converted to the same pressure and temperature.

value.name: gross calorific value standard
value.description: The amount of heat which would be released by the complete combustion in air of a specific quantity of a specified component product at standard temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element grossCalorificValueStd in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: heat transfer coefficient class
value.description: PRESSURE PER VELOCITY PER AREA

value.name: internal control valve status
value.description: The status of which the Internal Coltrol Valve sleeve is set to.

value.name: length per length
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is length.

value.name: mass
value.description: The mass of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element mass in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: mass class
value.description: M/L2T

value.name: mass concentration
value.description: The concentration of the specified component product as a weight percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element weightPercent in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: mass concentration class
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is mass.

value.name: mass per length
value.description: M /L4T

value.name: measured depth
value.description: Measured depth of the specified facility with respect to the specified datum.

value.name: molar concentration
value.description: The molar amount of a specified component product. Equivalent to element moleAmt in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: molar fraction
value.description: The molar fraction of the specified component product as a molar amount percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element molePercent in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: molecular weight
value.description: The molecular weight of a specified component product. Equivalent to element molecularWeight in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: motor current
value.description: Current at which the motor operates.

value.name: motor current leakage
value.description: Leakage current of the motor.

value.name: motor speed
value.description: Speed at which the motor operates.

value.name: motor temperature
value.description: Motor temperature.

value.name: motor vibration
value.description: The vibration (distortion) of which the motor produces.

value.name: motor voltage
value.description: Voltage at which the motor Operates.

value.name: opening size
value.description: The size of an opening. For example, a valve diameter. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

value.name: pH class
value.description: The pH is a class that measures the hydrogen ion concentration (acidity).

value.name: pressure
value.description: Pressure in the flow stream. Equivalent to element pres in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: pressure squared per force time per area
value.quantityMeasureClass: pressure squared per force time per area

value.name: pump count online
value.description: The number of pumps which are active. This should be implemented as a whole numbered value.

value.name: pump status
value.description: The operating status of the pump.

value.name: quantity
value.description: The abstract super-type of all floating point properties with a unit of measure.

value.name: reciprocating speed
value.description: The reciprocating speed of a device (e.g., motor, compressor).

value.name: rectifier structure potential
value.description: Rectifier Structure Potential.

value.name: reid vapor pressure
value.description: Reid vapor pressure of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. The absolute vapor pressure of volatile crude oil and volatile petroleum liquids, except liquefied petroleum gases, as determined in accordance with American Society for Testing and Materials under the designation ASTM D323-56. Equivalent to element rvp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: relative opening size
value.description: The size of an opening. A value of 100 % indicates that it is open. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

value.name: relative power class
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is power.

value.name: relative tank level
value.description: Defines the relative level of a tank. Zero indicates empty and 100% indicates full.

value.name: relative time class
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is time.

value.name: relative valve opening
value.description: Indicates the status of a valve. A value of 100 % indicates that it is open. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

value.name: root property
value.description: The abstract supertype of all properties. This property does not have a parent.

value.name: scheduled downtime
value.description: Indicates the amount of time the facility has been unavailable during the specified period. May be related to a particular point in time which would represent the start of the downtime.

value.name: shutdown order
value.description: Defines the relative order in which a facility should be shutdown. This should be implemented as a whole numbered count. Facilities with smaller values should be shut down first. Only facility parameters with the same version time and same version source should be evaluated together for the purposes of this order.

value.name: shutin pressure
value.description: A pressure value within a non-flowing system.

value.name: shutin temperature
value.description: A temperature value within a non-flowing system.

value.name: specific gravity
value.description: The specific gravity of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element sg in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: sub surface safety valve status
value.description: Status of the Sub Surface Safety Valve.

value.name: surface safety valve status
value.description: Status of the Surface Safety Valve.

value.name: tank fluid level
value.description: The vertical height of the specified product in a tank.

value.name: tank product standard volume
value.description: The volume of the specified product in a tank, corrected to standard conditions of temperature and pressure.

value.name: tank product volume
value.description: The volume of the specified product in a tank.

value.name: temperature
value.description: The temperature of the context for the property (e.g.,a flow stream or a facility). Equivalent to element temp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: true vapor pressure
value.description: True vapor pressure of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow The equilibrium partial pressure exerted by a petroleum liquid as determined in accordance with standard methods. Equivalent to element tvp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: unitless
value.description: The abstract supertype of all floating point properties with NO unit of measure. In order to allow the unit information to be required for all continuous properties, the special unit of measure of "NONE" has been assigned to all children of this class. In addition, the special dimensional class of "0" has been assigned to all children of this class.

value.name: valve opening
value.description: Indicates the open area of a valve. A value of zero indicates that it is closed.

value.name: valve status
value.description: A coded value describing the status of a valve.

value.name: volume
value.description: The volume of the context for the property (e.g., a flow stream or a specified component product within the flow). Equivalent to element volumeValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: volume concentration
value.description: The concentration of the specified component product as a volume percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element concentration in the productVolume data-schema. The volumes related to each component should have been at or converted to the same pressure and temperature.

value.name: volume per volume
value.description: A dimensionless quantity where the basis of the ratio is volume.

value.name: volume standard
value.description: The volume of the context for the property (e.g., a flow stream or a specified component product within the flow) corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element volumeValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: volumetric efficiency
value.description: The actual volume divided by the potential volume. Equivalent to element efficiency in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: well operating status
value.description: A coded value describing operating status of a well.

value.name: well operation type
value.description: This commonly called the "well type". It characterizes the well based on its mode of lifting the product. This should be implemented as a string value.

value.name: wobbe index
value.description: The Wobbe Index is a number which indicates interchangeability of fuel gasses and is obtained by dividing the heating value of a gas by the square root of its specific gravity. Equivalent to element wobbeIndex in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: work
value.description: The electrical energy represented by the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element work in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: FiberMode
enumList.description: The mode of a Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS) fiber.

value.name: singlemode
value.description: A single, narrow, core of constant refractive index, surrounded by glass cladding. The core diameter is comparable to a wave length of the light (about 5 um).

value.name: multimode
value.description: The core has a graded refractive index. The core is generally about 50um in diameter.

value.name: other
value.description: The fiber mode is neither singlemode or multimode.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: FlowQualifier
enumList.description: Defines qualifiers for type of flow.

value.name: allocated
value.description: Indicates product characteristics that were allocated back to a well as opposed to being measured at the well.

value.name: budget
value.description: A performance requirement as determined by a budget.

value.name: constraint
value.description: Indicates product characteristics that were determined by an allowable or other performance limit. This includes allowables which are usually established by a regulatory agency for a product.

value.name: difference
value.description: A value that is the difference between e.g. a target value and a metered value.

value.name: forecast
value.description: A forecast future value.

value.name: derived
value.description: Indicates product volumes that were derived directly from one or more other flows.

value.name: estimate
value.description: An estimated or calculated performance, possibly based on comparable product flow units, but not based on reservoir simulations for the particular product flow unit.

value.name: mass adjusted
value.description: The Flow is the resulting flow resulting from a mass adjustment process.

value.name: measured
value.description: Indicates product volumes that were actually measured at the port.

value.name: metered
value.description: A value that is read off an officially calibrated instrument (e.g. a gas chromatograph).

value.name: metered - fiscal
value.description: A value that is generated by measurement and calculation and has an impact on company revenue and government taxation.

value.name: nominated
value.description: Normally a 1 day forecast promise to a buyer.

value.name: potential
value.description: The estimated maximum which is possible.

value.name: processed
value.description: A measured value that has been processed. This is different from derived because it is fundamentally a variation of the original value.

value.name: quota
value.description: An amount, set by some authority, which may or may not be based on technical criteria.

value.name: recommended
value.description: A value which is believed to be very desirable if it can be achieved. This a recommendation that something be changed in order to achieve this value.

value.name: simulated
value.description: An estimated performance based on a simulation that includes the particular product flow unit.

value.name: target
value.description: The desired value. What you are aiming for.

value.name: tariff basis
value.description: The flow represents the basis on which a tariff is charged, rather than necessarily the actual flow.

value.name: value adjusted
value.description: A value that is adjusted due to a change in the value of a product.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: FlowSubQualifier
enumList.description: Defines a specialization of a flow qualifier.

value.name: decline curve
value.description: Indicates a pseudo decline-curve of flow rate over time. This presumes that the flow will not be interrupted over that time period. Specialization of "forecast".

value.name: difference
value.description: A value is derived by taking the difference between two other values. Specialization of "derived".

value.name: fiscal
value.description: The value was measured for fiscal purposes. Specialization of "measured".

value.name: fixed
value.description: The value supplied is the only value permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

value.name: minimum
value.description: The value supplied is the minimum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

value.name: maximum
value.description: The value supplied is the maximum permitted. Specialization of "constraint".

value.name: raw
value.description: The value is a raw measurement. Specialization of "measured".

value.name: recalibrated
value.description: The value has changed due to a recalibration of the sensor. Specialization of "measured".

value.name: standard
value.description: A standard forecast as opposed to a decline curve. Specialization of "forecast".

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: FluidComponentKind
enumList.description: Defines, for a Fluid Component in a mixture such as an oil or gas, that the component is of a given kind

value.name: pure
value.description: The component is a pure substance, i.e. comprised of one kind of molecules

value.name: frac
value.description: The component is a fraction, i.e. comprised of a mixture of molecules characterized by having closely similar boiling points

value.name: plus
value.description: The component is a plus-fraction, i.e. comprised of a mixture of molecules lumped together and characterized by having higher molecular weights and boiling points than the carbon number of the plus fraction

value.name: split
value.description: The component is a pseudo component, i.e. comprised of a mixture of molecules lumped together and characterized by an average molecular weight, boiling point and other properties

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: InstalledFiberPoint
enumList.description: The type of Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS) fiber point.

value.name: splice
value.description: A point at which a fiber is physically, and semi-permanently, connected to another length of fiber.

value.name: connector
value.description: A point at which a cable connector is installed, which allows the fiber to be connected to another instrument or fiber length.

value.name: end of fiber
value.description: The end of the fiber. If a U-geometry is used, and a connector is at both ends, the connector classification should be used rather than the end of fiber classification.

value.name: base of fiber
value.description: The deepest point of the installed fiber in a well. This is a valid value for fiber installations that do NOT turn around at the bottom (J- and U-type installations).

value.name: turn around point
value.description: The point in the turn-around-sub at which measured depth stops increasing and begins decreasing. This is a valid value for fiber installations of the J- and U- type only.

value.name: start of fiber
value.description: The start of the fiber. If appropriate, the connector classification should be used instead of this classification.

value.name: oven entry point
value.description: The point on the fiber at which it enters the oven.

value.name: oven exit point
value.description: The point on the fiber at which it exits the oven. The oven exit point should be closer to the wellbore than the oven entry point.

value.name: downhole gauge
value.description: A downhole point on the fiber at which a gauge is attached.

value.name: DTS laser head
value.description: The connector between the laser head and the optical fiber.

value.name: DTS reference oven
value.description: The oven within or near the DTS instrument box which maintains a length of fiber at a reference temperature.

value.name: splice box
value.description: Container in which ends of lengths of fiber are joined.

value.name: wellhead junction box
value.description: The device at which a fiber originating at the instrument box is joined to a fiber installed in a wellbore. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated

value.name: base tubing hanger flange
value.description: The device at the base of the wellhead to which the production tubing is attached. This is a recommended location at which LengthAlongFiber and measuredDepth in the wellbore are correlated.

value.name: PBR wet connect
value.description: The top-most point at which the fiber intersects the PBR (polished bore receptacle). For J- and U- installations, on the upward portion of the fiber, this is the point at which it leaves the pbf.

value.name: top ESP pump
value.description: The top of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the minimum measured depth point of the pump.

value.name: base ESP pump
value.description: The base of the electrical submersible pump (ESP). This is the maximum measured depth point of the pump.

value.name: wellhead temperature gauge
value.description: Temperature measuring device at the wellhead independent of the optic fiber sensor.

value.name: top completion zone
value.description: The point which is the minimum measured depth of a completion zone.

value.name: base completion zone
value.description: The point which is the maximum measured depth of a completion zone.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: OperationKind
enumList.description: The type of operation for which general comments can be defined.

value.name: production
value.description: Production operations.

value.name: well
value.description: Well operations.

value.name: deviations
value.description: Deviations from existing procedures and guidelines.

value.name: maintenance
value.description: Maintenance work.

value.name: construction
value.description: Construction work.

value.name: power station failure
value.description: Failure of a power station.

value.name: air traffic
value.description: Air traffic in the area.

value.name: other
value.description: Other comment relevant for the production periods on the installation.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: OTDRReason
enumList.description: The reason an Optical Time Domain Reflectometry (OTDR) test was run within a Distributed Temperature Survey (DTS).

value.name: pre-installation
value.description: The OTDR was run prior to installing the fiber in the well.

value.name: post-installation
value.description: The OTDR was run after installing the fiber in the well in order to quality check the installation process.

value.name: DTS run
value.description: The OTDR was run in conjunction with a DTS run. This is generally immediately preceding the timed run.

value.name: other
value.description: The OTDR was run for another reason.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: PhoneType
enumList.description: One method of characterizing a phone number.

value.name: voice
value.description: The telephone number is a conventional number which is used for voice contact.

value.name: fax
value.description: The telephone number is exclusively used for receiving faxes.

value.name: mobile
value.description: The telephone number is a mobile telephone, such as a cell phone.

value.name: voice/fax
value.description: The telephone at this number is capable of voice communication and of receiving faxes.

value.name: voicemail
value.description: The telephone is connected directly to voice mail. A voice phone may lead a caller to voice mail. However this choice qualifies the phone type as being only voice mail.

value.name: pager
value.description: The telephone is intended only for pages.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.
