enumList.description: Defines the types of Product Flow Ports.

value.name: inlet
value.description: An inlet port by which fluid normally flows into the Product Flow Unit.

value.name: outlet
value.description: An inlet port by which fluid normally flows out of Product Flow Unit.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ReasonLost
enumList.description: Reason for lost production.

value.name: topside equipment failure-maint
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to equipment failure and maintenance topside.

value.name: extended maint turnaround
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to extended maintenance turnaround.

value.name: extended maint turnaround export
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to extended maintenance turnaround on export terminal.

value.name: preventive maint topside
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to preventive maintenance topside.

value.name: planned maint turnaround
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to planned maintenance turnaround.

value.name: marked oil
value.description: Estimated loss of oil production due to lost export due to marked product.

value.name: marked gas
value.description: Estimated loss of gas production due to lost export due to marked product.

value.name: modification project
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to modification projects.

value.name: operation mistakes
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to operation mistakes reference.

value.name: other
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to unspecified reasons.

value.name: process and operation problem
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to process and operation problems.

value.name: production
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to total loss of production.

value.name: regulatory reference
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to regulatory reference.

value.name: reservoir
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to reservoir losses.

value.name: testing and logging
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to well testing and logging.

value.name: unavailable tanker storage
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to unavailable tanker storage.

value.name: well equipment failure-maint
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to well equipment failure and maintenance.

value.name: well planned operations
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to planned well operations.

value.name: well preventive maint
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to preventive maintenance on a well.

value.name: weather problem
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to weather conditions.

value.name: hse
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to Safety or Emergency requirements.

value.name: strike/lock-out
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to strike or lock-out.

value.name: 3rd party processing
value.description: Estimated loss of production due to 3rd party processing.

value.name: daily total loss of prod
value.description: Estimated total loss of production.

value.name: well problems
value.description: Estimated loss of production due well problems.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

value.name: block valve
value.description: A single block valve.

value.name: bottomhole
value.description: A single bottomhole.

value.name: casing
value.description: A production casing (steel pipe) used to seal and stabilize a wellbore.

value.name: choke
value.description: A single choke.

value.name: cluster
value.description: A single cluster.

value.name: commercial entity
value.description: A commercial entity is an organizational construct through which the a group of organizations or facilities are grouped as if it were a single composite.

value.name: company
value.description: A company name that is the name of the operator company.

value.name: completion
value.description: A single completion.

value.name: compressor
value.description: A single compressor.

value.name: controller
value.description: A single lift gas controller.

value.name: controller -- lift
value.description: "DEPRECATED: use ""controller"" instead."

value.name: country
value.description: A single country.

value.name: county
value.description: A single county.

value.name: downhole monitoring system
value.description: An equipment permanently fitted in the well's tubing that is equipped with pressure and temperature sensors.

value.name: electric submersible pump
value.description: An artificial-lift system that utilizes a downhole pumping system that is electrically driven.

value.name: field
value.description: A single field.

value.name: field - area
value.description: A ground that is an area above an oilfield.

value.name: field - group
value.description: An area concept that is a grouping of two or more selected petroleum fields for commercial reasons or other purposes.

value.name: field - part
value.description: An area concept that is an area that forms part of a petroleum field.

value.name: flow meter
value.description: A single flow meter.

value.name: flowline
value.description: A single flowline.

value.name: formation
value.description: A bed or deposit composed throughout of substantially the same kind of rock.

value.name: gas lift valve mandrel
value.description: A gas-lift system component that is assembled with the production tubing string onto which or into which a gas-lift valve is fitted.

value.name: generator
value.description: A single electrical generator.

value.name: installation
value.description: A physical object that is an appliance involved in the extraction, production, transportation or storage of oil or gas.

value.name: lease
value.description: A single lease.

value.name: license
value.description: A regulatory agreement that gives the licensees excluding rights to investigate, explore and recover petroleum deposits within the geographical area and time period stated in the agreement.

value.name: manifold
value.description: An accessory system of piping to a main piping system that serves to divide a flow into several parts, to combine several flows into one, or to reroute a flow to any one of several possible destinations.

value.name: organizational unit
value.description: A logical unit of organization for production reporting.

value.name: packer
value.description: A device used to make a seal between the outside of the production tubing and the inside of the casing.

value.name: perforated interval
value.description: The section of wellbore that has been prepared for production by creating channels between the reservoir formation and the wellbore.

value.name: pipeline
value.description: A fluid conductor that consists of pipe, possibly also including pumps, valves, and control devices, intended for conveying liquids, gases, or finely divided solids.

value.name: plant - processing
value.description: A facility that processes natural gas to achieve the recovery of natural gas liquids.

value.name: platform
value.description: A single platform.

value.name: pressure meter
value.description: A single pressure meter. Note that this represents the device and not the sensor itself.

value.name: processing facility
value.description: A single production processing facility.

value.name: production tubing
value.description: A tube placed in a wellbore through which production fluids travel.

value.name: pump
value.description: A single pump.

value.name: rectifier
value.description: An electrical device that converts alternating current (AC) to direct current (DC).

value.name: regulating valve
value.description: A device used to regulate the rate of flow of a fluid.

value.name: remote terminal unit
value.description: A unit that transmits signals received from sensors to SCADA.

value.name: reservoir
value.description: A single reservoir.

value.name: separator
value.description: A single separator.

value.name: sleeve valve
value.description: A single sleeve valve. This is a type of tubing valve which has a sliding sleeve to cover holes in the tubing. You cover all of the holes in order to close the valve. For configurations oriented toward production, the inlet is on the casing side and the outlet is on the tubing side. For injection, the reverse would be true.

value.name: state
value.description: A single state or province.

value.name: storage
value.description: A system for the storage of gaseous, liquid and solid products.

value.name: tank
value.description: A single tank.

value.name: temperature meter
value.description: A single temperature meter. Note that this represents the device and not the sensor itself.

value.name: template
value.description: A single template.

value.name: terminal
value.description: A physical object that is an industrial facility for the storage of oil and/or petrochemical products and from which these products are usually transported to end users or further storage facilities.

value.name: trap
value.description: An equipment, that has sensors installed, designed to trap sand that is associated with the well's produced/injected fluids.

value.name: trunkline
value.description: A single trunkline.

value.name: tubing head
value.description: A single tubing head within a wellhead.

value.name: turbine
value.description: A gas turbine used to generate power eg for electricaL power generation or pumping.

value.name: well group
value.description: A single named group of wells.

value.name: well
value.description: A single well, possibly with many wellbores (sidetracks).

value.name: wellbore
value.description: A single wellbore (sidetrack) within a well.

value.name: wellhead
value.description: A single wellhead for one well. See also "tubing head".

value.name: zone
value.description: A single zone.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ReportingFlow
enumList.description: Defines the types of flows for volume reports.

value.name: consume
value.description: Consumed (all methods) by the facility.

value.name: consume - black start
value.description: Consummed to restart power facilities as a result of an overall power outage.

value.name: consume - compressor
value.description: Consummed by compressors.

value.name: consume - non compressor
value.description: Consumed by devices other than compressors.

value.name: consume - emitted
value.description: Released into the atmosphere as a by-product of consumption.

value.name: consume - flare
value.description: Burned in a flare. A fluid stream that has one or more flares as the ultimate target.

value.name: consume - HP flare
value.description: Burned in a high pressure flare.

value.name: consume - LP flare
value.description: Burned in a low pressure flare.

value.name: consume - fuel
value.description: Consumed by processing equipment.

value.name: consume - venting
value.description: Released into the atmosphere.

value.name: disposal
value.description: A fluid stream that contains waste fluids for disposal.

value.name: export
value.description: Leaving the installation for commercialized purposes.

value.name: export - requested
value.description: Requested to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

value.name: export - nominated
value.description: Planned to leave the installation for commercialized purposes.

value.name: export - shortfall
value.description: Difference between what was requested and what was delivered.

value.name: gas lift
value.description: Injected into a producing well to reduce the hydrostatic pressure of the fluid column. The resulting reduction in bottom hole pressure allows the reservoir liquids to flow.

value.name: hydrocarbon accounting
value.description: An accounting of all of the fluids into and out of Stock (i.e., Inventory) which includes all storage facilities at a site including fluid within a pipeline.

value.name: import
value.description: Entering the facility for commercialized purposes.

value.name: injection
value.description: Inject into a well.

value.name: inventory
value.description: Stock at a facility. For a period that represents an event, the amount would represent the current amount of inventory. For other periods, the amount would represent the addition (positive value) or drawdown (negative value) over that period. For an individual storage facility (e.g., a tank), the amounts would represent that tank. For an overall facility, the amounts would represent all tanks.

value.name: overboard
value.description: Dropped overboard into the sea.

value.name: production
value.description: Exploited from a reservoir. This is independent of any disposition.

value.name: sale
value.description: A fluid stream that is sold and transported to a buyer by pipeline.

value.name: storage
value.description: A fluid stream that is directed to one or more storage locations.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

value.name: day
value.description: A period of one day. If the report does not represent one day then this represents the 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

value.name: week
value.description: A period of one week. If the report does not represent one week then this represents the 7 times 24 hour period ending at the end of the report period.

value.name: month
value.description: A period of one calendar month.

value.name: year
value.description: A period of one Gregorian year.

value.name: year to date
value.description: A period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period.

value.name: month to date
value.description: A period from the beginning of the calendar month to the end of the report period.

value.name: daily year to date
value.description: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the year to the end of the report period

value.name: daily month to date
value.description: The average per day over the period from the beginning of the month to the end of the report period

value.name: total cumulative
value.description: A period with no beginning that ends at the end of the report period.

value.name: report
value.description: A period coinciding with the report period.

value.name: report start
value.description: A point in time coinciding with the start of report period.

value.name: report end
value.description: A point in time coinciding with the end of report period.

value.name: previous period
value.description: The previous reporting period. For example, if the report period represents a day then the previous period represents the previous day.

value.name: midnight
value.description: A point in time coinciding with midnight during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at midnight - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

value.name: noon
value.description: A point in time coinciding with noon during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at noon - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

A point in time coinciding with 6 am during the report period. This can be ambiguous if the report begins and ends at 6 am - use report start/end instead. This cannot be used for a reporting period that is greater than 24 hours.

value.name: gas day
value.description: A period in time that is all space of time within a day (24 hour period) starting at 06:00 AM and ending 06:00 AM next day.

value.name: gas month
value.description: A period in time that is all space of time within a whole given month starting at 06:00 AM the first day and ending at 06:00 AM the first day of next month.

value.name: gas year
value.description: A period in time that is all time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st and ending at same date and time the following year.

value.name: gas year to date
value.description: A period in time that is all space of time within a period starting at 06:00 AM October 1st ending at 06:00 AM at a given date.

value.name: life to date
value.description: A period in time that is all space of time within a period from starting up an equipment, installation, field, license, etc, to a given date.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

value.name: C2+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C3+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C4+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C5+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C6+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C7+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C8+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C9+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C10+
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all heavier components.

value.name: C2-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C3-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C4-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C5-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C6-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C7-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C8-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C9-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: C10-
value.description: A product composed of the component with the specified number of carbon atoms plus all lighter components.

value.name: oleic
value.description: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous materials are liquid hydrocarbons. This phase is often called the "oil phase".

value.name: aqueous
value.description: An undifferentiated liquid fluid phase in which the dominant continuous material is liquid water. This phase is often called the "water phase".

value.name: vapor
value.description: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly gaseous. This phase is often called the "gas phase".

value.name: liquid
value.description: An undifferentiated fluid phase that is distinctly liquid. This includes water.

value.name: C7
value.description: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with seven carbon atoms.

value.name: C8
value.description: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with eight carbon atoms.

value.name: C9
value.description: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with nine carbon atoms.

value.name: C10
value.description: A hydrocarbon compound that consists of mainly hydrocarbon molecules with ten carbon atoms.

value.name: carbon monoxide gas
value.description: Carbon monoxide in a gaseous state.

value.name: carbon dioxide gas
value.description: Carbon dioxide in a gaseous state.

value.name: chemical
value.description: A chemical of some type.

value.name: condensate
value.description: Mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons in a liquid state.

value.name: condensate - gross
value.description: Light hydrocarbon fractions produced with natural gas, which condense into liquid at normal temperatures and pressures associated with surface production equipment.

value.name: condensate - net
value.description: Hydrocatbon condensate containing only the heavier carbon fractions C5 to C10+.

value.name: crude - stabilized
value.description: A crude oil that has been stabilized by separating out dissolved gas.

value.name: cuttings
value.description: Drill cuttings.

value.name: diethylene glycol
value.description: A compound where the main component is diethylene glycol.

value.name: diesel
value.description: Diesel fuel.

value.name: dioxygen
value.description: Oxygen

value.name: electric power
value.description: Electrical power.

value.name: ethane
value.description: A compound where the main component is ethane.

value.name: ethane - component
value.description: Ethane as a component in another fluid.

value.name: gas
value.description: Gas mixture of hydrocarbons.

value.name: gas - dry
value.description: A natural gas that occurs in the absence of condensate or liquid hydrocarbons, or gas that has had condensible hydrocarbons removed, mainly consisting of methane gas.

value.name: gas - rich
value.description: Gas mixture of light and heavier hydrocarbons than a lean gas.

value.name: gas - wet
value.description: A natural gas that contains less methane (typically less than 85% methane) and more ethane and other more complex hydrocarbons like propane, butane and naphtha.

value.name: gas - component in oil
value.description: Gas as a component in oil.

value.name: helium gas
value.description: Helium

value.name: heptane
value.description: A compound where the main component is heptane.

value.name: hydraulic control fluid
value.description: hydraulic control fluid as used to actuate remote devices

value.name: hydrogen gas
value.description: Hydrogen

value.name: hydrogen sulfide
value.description: A compound where the main component is hydrogen sulfide.

value.name: i-butane - component
value.description: I-butane as a component in another fluid.

value.name: isobutane
value.description: A compound where the main component is isobutane.

value.name: isopentane
value.description: A compound where the main component is isopentane.

value.name: liquefied natural gas
value.description: A liquid compound that is natural gas compressed and supercooled to -167 deg C (-269 deg F) into a liquid to reduce its volume to 1/635th for storage and transportation. Liquefied natural gas has a calorific value of 22,300 Btu/lb. It consists of about 91% of methane and 7% ethane with some propane, butane, and higher hydrocarbons. One tonne liquefied natural gas is equal to about 53 Mcf of gas. Liquified natural gas can be vaporized by ambient air, another fluid, or direct fired vaporizer.

value.name: liquefied petroleum gas
value.description: A liquid compound that is predominantly butane and propane separated from natural gasoline or natural gas and sold as fuel - commonly known as bottled gas, tank gas or LP-gas.

value.name: methane
value.description: A compound where the main component is methane.

value.name: methane - component
value.description: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

value.name: methanol
value.description: A compound where the main component is methanol.

value.name: mixed butane
value.description: A compound where the main components are butane and isobutane.

value.name: monoethylene glycol
value.description: A compound where the main component is monoethylene glycol.

value.name: n-butane - component
value.description: N-butane as a component in another fluid.

value.name: naphta
value.description: An aggregate that is a volatile and inflammable product of crude oil refining with a boiling range 140 - 210 deg. Celsius consisting of C5+ to C10 components (pentanes and hexanes).

value.name: natural gas liquid
value.description: Mixture of ethane, propane and butane with small quantities of heaver hydrocarbons. Partially liquid at atmospheric pressure.

value.name: neopentane
value.description: A compound where the main component is neopentane.

value.name: nitrogen gas
value.description: A gasous compound where the main component is nitrogen.

value.name: nitrogen oxide gas
value.description: Nitrogen oxides in a gaseous state

value.name: NGL - component in gas
value.description: Natural gas liquid as a component in gas.

value.name: normal butane
value.description: A compound where the main component is butane.

value.name: normal pentane
value.description: A compound where the main component is pentane.

value.name: oil and gas
value.description: A combination of oil (including water) and gas. This is generally used when referring to 'all production'.

value.name: oil
value.description: Crude oil including water. A mixture of hydrocarbons, that existed in liquid phase in underground reservoirs and remains liquid at atmospheric pressure after passing through separating facilities.

value.name: oil - gross
value.description: A crude oil that that includes all petroleum liquids and sediments and water, excluding free water.

value.name: oil - net
value.description: A crude oil that includes all petroleum liquids excluding sediments and water as well as free water.

value.name: oil - component in water
value.description: Oil as a component in water.

value.name: pentane - component
value.description: The hydrocarbon pentane C5H12 which has several isomers

value.name: petroleum gas liquid
value.description: DEPRECATED - See liquefied natural gas.

value.name: propane
value.description: A compound where the main component is propane.

value.name: propane - component
value.description: Propane as a component in another fluid.

value.name: salt
value.description: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

value.name: sand - component
value.description: Sand as a component in another fluid.

value.name: triethylene glycol
value.description: A compound where the main component is triethylene glycol.

value.name: water
value.description: Water in a liquid state.

value.name: water - discharge
value.description: Produced water that has not been processed.

value.name: water - processed
value.description: Produced water that has been processed to remove hydrocarbons.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ReportingProperty
enumList.description: The type of properties that can be measured at a port.

value.name: alarm absolute pressure
value.description: Absolute minimum pressure of the flow stream before the system will give an alarm. Equivalent to element absoluteMinPres in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: atmospheric pressure
value.description: The average atmospheric pressure during the reporting period. Equivalent to element atmosphere in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: density
value.description: The density of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element densityValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: density flow rate
value.description: The mass basis flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. This is used for things like a sand component. Equivalent to element densityFlowRate in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: density standard
value.description: The density of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element densityValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: dewpoint temperature standard
value.description: The temperature at which the specified component product within the flow will start to condense out of the gaseous phase, corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element hcDewpoint or waterDewpoint (depending on the specified product) in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: differential pressure
value.description: The differential pressure between the ports. Presumes a facility with only two ports. Equivalent to element portDiff/presDiff in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: differential temperature
value.description: The differential pressure between the ports. Presumes a facility with only two ports. Equivalent to element portDiff/tempDiff in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: efficiency
value.description: The actual volume of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow divided by the potential volume. Equivalent to element efficiency in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: flow rate
value.description: The flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element flowRateValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: flow rate standard
value.description: The flow rate of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element flowRateValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: gas liquid ratio
value.description: The volumetric ratio of gas to liquid for all products in the whole flow stream. Equivalent to element gasLiquidRatio in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: gas oil ratio
value.description: The volumetric ratio between the total gas volume and the total oil volume in the flow stream. Equivalent to element gor in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: gross calorific value standard
value.description: The amount of heat which would be released by the complete combustion in air of a specific quantity of a specified component product at standard temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element grossCalorificValueSt in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: mass
value.description: The mass of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element mass in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: mass concentration
value.description: The concentration of the specified component product as a weight percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element weightPercent in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: molar amount
value.description: The molar amount of a specified component product. Equivalent to element moleAmt in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: molar fraction
value.description: The molar fraction of the specified component product as a molar amount percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element molePercent in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: molecular weight
value.description: The molecular weight of a specified component product. This is a unitless quantity. Equivalent to element molecularWeight in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: pressure
value.description: Pressure in the flow stream. Equivalent to element pres in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: reid vapor pressure
value.description: Reid vapor pressure of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. The absolute vapor pressure of volatile crude oil and volatile petroleum liquids, except liquefied petroleum gases, as determined in accordance with American Society for Testing and Materials under the designation ASTM D323-56. Equivalent to element rvp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: specific gravity
value.description: The specific gravity of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element sg in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: temperature
value.description: Temperature of the port. Equivalent to element temp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: true vapor pressure
value.description: True vapor pressure of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow The equilibrium partial pressure exerted by a petroleum liquid as determined in accordance with standard methods. Equivalent to element tvp in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: volume
value.description: The volume of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element volumeValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: volume concentration
value.description: The concentration of the specified component product as a volume percentage of the flow stream. Equivalent to element concentration in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: volume standard
value.description: The volume of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow corrected to specific conditions of temperature and pressure as specified by the standardTempPres element in the productVolume data-schema. Equivalent to element volumeValue in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: wobbe index
value.description: The volume of the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. The Wobbe Index is a number which indicates interchangeability of fuel gasses and is obtained by dividing the heating value of a gas by the square root of its specific gravity. Equivalent to element wobbeIndex in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: work
value.description: The electrical energy represented by the flow stream or a specified component product within the flow. Equivalent to element work in the productVolume data-schema.

value.name: standard volume
value.description: DEPRECATED: use "volume standard" instead.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ReportVersionStatus
enumList.description: The status of a version of a report.

value.name: final
value.description: The final version of a report

value.name: preliminary
value.description: A preliminary version of a report

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ReservoirFluidKind
enumList.description: Defines the reservoir hydrocarbon fluid in broad terms of its phase behavior.

value.name: black oil
value.description: The reservoir fluid is predominantly oil with dissolved gas

value.name: volatile oil
value.description: The reservoir fluid is a light oil with a high proportion of dissolved gas

value.name: critical or near critical
value.description: The reservoir fluid is a light oil and gas mix which exits close to its critical point in the reservoir

value.name: wet gas or condensate
value.description: The reservoir fluid is gaseous but will yield some hydrocarbon liquid when brought to surface

value.name: dry gas
value.description: The reservoir fluid is gaseous and will yield no material hydrocarbon liquid when brought to surface

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: SafetyType
enumList.description: The type of safety issues for which a count can be defined.

value.name: drill or exercise
value.description: The safety issue is a drill or exercise

value.name: fire
value.description: The safety issue is a fire

value.name: first aid
value.description: The safety issue required first aid

value.name: hazard report card
value.description: The safety issue is a hazard report card being completed

value.name: job observation
value.description: The safety issue is an observation being made

value.name: lost time incident
value.description: The safety issue is an incident which resulted in an injured employee who required medical treatment and could not return to work the next day.

value.name: lost time accident
value.description: The safety issue is an accident resulting in lost time from work .

value.name: miscellaneous
value.description: The safety issue is in the miscellaneous category

value.name: near miss
value.description: The safety issue is an incident which, under different circumstances, could have caused injury, illness and/or major damage to/loss of assets, or harm to the environment or to a third party.

value.name: permit with SJA
value.description: The safety issue is a a permit with a Safe Job Analysis.

value.name: released to air
value.description: The safety issue is a release of fluids to air

value.name: released to water
value.description: The safety issue is a release of fluids to water

value.name: restricted work
value.description: The safety issue is restricted work

value.name: safety meeting
value.description: The safety issue is a safety meeting

value.name: sent ashore
value.description: The safety issue is a person being sent ashore

value.name: severe accident
value.description: The safety issue is a type of accident that may challenge safety systems at a level much higher than expected

value.name: sick on board
value.description: The safety issue is a person sick on board

value.name: spill or leak
value.description: The safety issue is a spill or leak

value.name: traffic accident
value.description: The safety issue is a traffic accident

value.name: total permits
value.description: The safety issue is a count of total permits

value.name: year-to-date incidents
value.description: The safety issue is a count of year-to-date incidents

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: StandardCondition
enumList.description: Combinations of standard temperature and pressure including "ambient".

value.name: ambient
value.description: Ambient conditions at the time of measurement. That is, the value has not been converted.

value.name: 0 degC 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of zero degrees Centigrade and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: 15 degC 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of sixty degrees Centigrade and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: 60 degF 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of fifteen degrees Fahrenheit and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: StandardTempPress
enumList.description: Combinations of standard temperature and pressure.

value.name: 0 degC 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of zero degrees Centigrade and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: 15 degC 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of sixty degrees Centigrade and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: 60 degF 1 atm
value.description: A temperature of fifteen degrees Fahrenheit and a pressure of one atmosphere.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: TimeSeriesKeyword
enumList.description: Keyword for defining keyword-value pairs in a time series.

value.name: asset identifier
value.description: A PRODML formatted URI identifier of the asset (facility) related to the value. This captures the kind of asset as well as the unique identifier of the asset within a specified context (the authority). The identifier may define a hierarchy of assets.

value.name: qualifier
value.description: A qualifier of the meaning of the value. This is used to distinguish between variations of an underlying meaning based on the method of creating the value (e.g., measured versus simulated). The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowQualifier.

value.name: subqualifier
value.description: A specialization of a qualifier. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type FlowSubQualifier.

value.name: product
value.description: The type of product that is represented by the value. This is generally used with things like volume or flow rate. It is generally meaningless for things like temperature or pressure. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingProduct.

value.name: flow
value.description: Defines the part of the flow network where the asset is located. This is most useful in situations (e.g., reporting) where detailed knowledge of the network configuration is not needed. Basically, this classifies different segments of the flow network based on its purpose within the context of the whole network. The values associated with this keyword must be from the list defined by type ReportingFlow.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ValidationOperation
enumList.description: A kind of well test validation operation.

value.name: acquisition validation
value.description: Checks against the acquired data.

value.name: site validation
value.description: Checks against site validation criteria.

value.name: allocation validation
value.description: Checks against back-allocation validation criteria.

value.name: external quality assurance
value.description: Checks against external quality assurance criteria. This operation must not have a result of "passed with changes".

value.name: validation result
value.description: The overall status of the test.

value.name: well model validation
value.description: Checks against a well model. This operation must not have a result of "passed with changes".

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ValidationResult
enumList.description: A result of a well test validation operation.

value.name: passed
value.description: The well test passed the validation criteria without modification of the data.

value.name: passed with changes
value.description: The well test passed the validation criteria after modification of the data.

value.name: failed
value.description: The well test failed the validation criteria.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ValidationState
enumList.description: An overall state of all well test validation operations.

value.name: unvalidated
value.description: The well test has not yet begun validation operations.

value.name: validating
value.description: The well test is in the process of being validated.

value.name: validated
value.description: The well test has completed validation operations. This does not mean that the test is valid - only that the validation steps have been completed.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: ValueStatus
enumList.description: An indicator of the quality of a value. This is designed for a SCADA or OPC style of value status. The token in parentheses are OPC's status string for the condition.

value.name: bad calibration
value.description: The calibration status of the sensor is unknown. (Out of Calibration)

value.name: range limit
value.description: The value is range limited, that is, at or near the end of range of the sensor. The value might be clamped. (Low Limited, High Limited)

value.name: questionable
value.description: The value is just plain questionable. (Sub-Normal, Non-specific)

value.name: device failure
value.description: The unit to which the sensor is attached is not running. (Device Failure)

value.name: sensor failure
value.description: The field sensor itself is not working due to hardware failure or misconfiguration. (Sensor Failure)

value.name: comm failure
value.description: The communication to the field sensor is not working. That is, communication cannot be established or maintained. (Comm Failure)

value.name: timeout
value.description: Communication to the field sensor has timed out, that is, a connection exists, but a request for a field sensor data value has failed. (Last Known Value)

value.name: frozen
value.description: The value has a frozen status - i.e. the sensor has been reading the same value for a specific period of time. Value is required.

value.name: substituted
value.description: This value has been manually input by the operator. Value is required. (Local Override)

value.name: bad
value.description: The value is bad for an unknown reason. Value is required. (Non-Specific)

value.name: overflow
value.description: There is an overflow indicated (conversion process). Resulting from a calculation. Value may be NaN.

value.name: calculation failure
value.description: The calculation for the value indicates failure. Value may be NaN.

value.name: not available
value.description: The input is not available. Value may be NaN. May be device, sensor, or comm failure, but the exact reason is unknown.

value.name: access denied
value.description: Access denied for this point. Value may be NaN.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: VolumeReferenceKind

enumList.name: WellOperationMethod
enumList.description: Kind of lift method for producing a well.

value.name: natural flow
value.description: Oil or gas well under natural flow.

value.name: continuous gas lift
value.description: Oil well under continuous gas lift.

value.name: intermittent gas lift
value.description: Oil well under intermittent gas lift.

enumList.name: WftFlowingIntervalKind
enumList.description: This is used to characterize the kind of connection between the wireline formation tester tool (WFT) and the formation via a section of wellbore. Since WFTs can have probes or pairs of packers, which have different geometries (respectively a point connection or a section of wellbore like a welltest), it is necessary to state which kind if flowing for this station.

value.name: probe
value.description: This is used to identify a probe connection between reservoir and WFT tool.

value.name: packed interval
value.description: This is to identify a connection between reservoir and WFT tool which is between a pair of packers, ie akin to the flow connection of a traditional drill stem test (DST) though usually on a smaller scale.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: WftEventKind
enumList.description: This is used to identify events occurring during the operation of a wireline formation tester (WFT) at a given station (i.e. a temporary fixed position in the wellbore where a series of tests will be made). This list could be expanded in future. Two basic events are documented.

value.name: tool set
value.description: This event describes the process of setting the WFT tool prior to tests being made at the station.

value.name: tool retract
value.description: This event describes the process of retracting the WFT tool after tests being made at the station, ready to move to another station or be retrieved from the wellbore.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: WftStationKind
enumList.description: This is used to characterize the kind of station. Two kinds are expected: conventional where flow is occurring and being measured, and observation where there is no flow and merely pressure observation of the effect at this station of flow which is occurring at a different station.

value.name: conventional
value.description: This is used to identify a station where flow is occurring and being measured, such as pressure, temperature and flowrate.

value.name: observation
value.description: This is used to identify a station where there is no flow occurring but the WFT tool is set and making pressure observation of the effect at this station of flow which is occurring at a different station.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: WftTestKind
enumList.description: This is used to characterize the kind of Test being carried out at a given time at a given station by a wireline formation tester (WFT). This list could be expanded in future. Two basic tests are documented.

value.name: drawdown
value.description: A drawdown test is where reservoir fluid is flowing into the WFT tool via a connection described by the flowing interval kind element.

value.name: buildup
value.description: A build up test is where there is no flow of reservoir fluid into the WFT tool, but because the connection described by the flowing interval kind element remains in place, the WFT tool is measuring the pressure in the reservoir at the sandface (ie the inside face of the wellbore). A buildup must be preceded by one or more drawdowns (during which the sandface pressure will have dropped), and during the buildup the pressure will rise again. Hence the name, buildup.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: WftTestResultKind
enumList.description: This is used to characterize the kind of test result. The kind of result typically represents a combination of test kind and analysis method applied. This list could be expanded in future. Two illustrative result kinds are documented.

value.name: buildup result
value.description: This refers to the result of analysis of a buildup. More specialist buildup results could be added to the enum list such as buildup horner analysis, etc.

value.name: drawdown result
value.description: This refers to the result of analysis of a drawdown.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: WftTestDataRole
enumList.description: This is used to characterize the test data being described. A curve of data may comprise one item of test data (by use of the curveSection element), in which case the wftTestDataRole is used to say what that curve "means" in the test. Alternatively a single parameter may characterize the test in some manner (by use of the parameter element), in which case the wftTestDataRole is used to say what that parameter "means" in the test. This list could be expanded in future. Two illustrative WftTestDataRole kinds are documented.

value.name: pressure stream
value.description: This would refer to a curveSection element and indicate the curve is a curve (a time series of data points) containing the pressure data.

value.name: flow history
value.description: This would refer to a curveSection element and indicate the curve is a curve (a time series of data points) containing the flowrate history data (used in pressure transient analysis.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.
